faqs.question: What does AXA Insurance UK plc Home Insurance insurance exclude?
faqs.answer:
The following are NOT covered under AXA Insurance UK plc's Home Insurance policy:

• Gradual damage, deterioration, wear and tear
• Damage arising from normal maintenance and upkeep
• Loss or damage while home is unoccupied for more than 30 days (most covers)
• Loss or damage while home is unfurnished for more than 30 days
• Mechanical or electrical breakdown or failure
• Damage caused by cleaning, maintenance, repair, dismantling or altering
• Damage by domestic animals (chewing, scratching, fouling, urinating)
• Damage by vermin or insects
• Settlement of new buildings
• Frost damage (under storm/flood)
• Damage to gates, hedges and fences (storm and subsidence)
• Coastal or river bank erosion
• Damage from faulty workmanship, defective design or materials
• Damage while property under construction or structural alteration
• Loss from failed online purchases or transactions
• Loss where payment proves counterfeit, false or fraudulent
• War, terrorism, radioactive contamination, sonic bangs
• Riot or civil commotion outside UK, Isle of Man or Channel Islands
• Reduction in market value following repair
• Confiscation by authorities
• Pollution/contamination (unless sudden and unforeseen)
• Deliberate or malicious acts by policyholder or family
• Loss or damage to virtual currencies
• Business use (except limited home office equipment)
• Vehicles or craft (with specific exceptions)
• Smoke damage arising gradually
• Damage caused by failure or lack of sealant/grout
• Loss or damage to pitch fibre drains from inherent defects
• Computer hacking, viruses, malware, contamination
• Unattended vehicle theft (unless items hidden and locked)
• Theft from unlocked hotel rooms
• Pedal cycle theft unless locked or in locked building
• Mobile phones (under entertainment equipment)
• Lottery and raffle tickets
• Plants and living creatures (most sections)
• Documents (except specific £500 cover)
• Dangerous dogs as listed under Dangerous Dogs Act 1991
• Horses, ponies, donkeys and mules
• Non-domesticated animal species
• Drones and aerial devices
• Transmission of contagious disease or virus

enhanced.quick_answer: AXA Home Insurance excludes many types of damage and losses that are considered preventable, gradual, or outside typical home risks. Key exclusions include wear and tear, damage from lack of maintenance, properties left empty for over 30 days, pet damage, vermin infestations, mechanical breakdowns, and damage during renovations. The policy also doesn't cover business use (beyond basic home office), certain high-value items like mobile phones and virtual currencies, or catastrophic events like war and terrorism.
enhanced.customer_impact: These exclusions mean customers need to maintain their home regularly and can't claim for damage that develops slowly over time or results from neglect. If they're planning to leave their property empty for more than a month, they must notify AXA or risk voiding their coverage. Customers with pets should understand that damage caused by their animals isn't covered, and those working from home need to verify their equipment is within policy limits. For extended absences, renovations, or business use beyond basic home office work, customers may need additional coverage or policy adjustments. Items like mobile phones, drones, and certain valuables require separate insurance if they want them protected.
communication_examples: I want to highlight a few important exclusions in your policy. The main thing to remember is that this covers sudden, unexpected damage – not wear and tear or gradual deterioration. So if a pipe suddenly bursts, you're covered, but if it's been slowly leaking and causes damage over time, that wouldn't be covered.

One key thing to be aware of: if your home is going to be empty for more than 30 days – whether you're traveling or between tenants – you'll need to let us know. Otherwise, most of your coverage won't apply during that period. We can discuss options to keep you protected during extended absences.

Your policy covers accidental damage in many situations, but there are some things it doesn't include – like damage from pets, maintenance issues, or if you're doing major renovations. I'd recommend reviewing the exclusions list so there aren't any surprises. And if you have items like drones, expensive bikes, or use significant equipment for business, we should talk about additional coverage for those.

common_followups.answer: Contact AXA before the 30-day period ends to discuss your options. They may be able to provide continued coverage with certain conditions (like regular property checks) or adjust your policy temporarily. Don't wait until after you've returned, as this could invalidate claims.

common_followups.question: My dog damaged the carpet – why isn't this covered?
common_followups.answer: The policy excludes damage caused by domestic pets, including chewing, scratching, and soiling. This is considered preventable damage within the homeowner's control. Pet damage insurance would require separate coverage or a specific add-on.

common_followups.question: Does this mean I can't work from home at all?
common_followups.answer: You can work from home with basic office equipment like a laptop and printer. The exclusion applies to significant business use, business stock, or commercial activities. If you're unsure whether your home office setup exceeds the policy limits, we should review your specific situation to determine if you need business equipment coverage.
